Token.Text: Races with highly efficient metabolisms require 25% less food each turn
Gluttonous races will gorge themselves at every opportunity, eating 25% more food every turn
Promiscuous natures, short gestation periods, and large litter sizes increase a race's rate of reproduction significantly. Minimum population growth is .01 per turn.
Long gestation periods and difficult reproductive processes substantially reduce the natural reproduction rate of this race. Maximum natural population growth is .02 per turn.
Savage races gain a +30% bonus in ground combat due to a ferocious temperament and various lethal physical characteristics
Timid races are instinctively terrified by combat and suffer a 20% penalty to ground combat rolls
Alluring races gain a +20 (out of 100) starting relationship with other races due to their majestic and charismatic natures
Offensive smells and revolting countenances earn repulsive races a -20 penalty (out of 100) to initial relationships with other races
Intelligent races gain a 35% bonus to research efforts
Dumb races suffer a 35% penalty to research efforts due to their slow grasp of complex ideas
Incredible eyesight gives pilots from this race a 20% accuracy bonus to projectiles fired from cannon weapons
Races that evolve weak optical sensory organs suffer a penalty in space combat. Cannon projectiles have 20% accuracy penalty
Ultra-fast reflexes grant ship pilots from this race a 25% bonus chance to dodge projectiles that otherwise would be hits
Races with ponderous and deliberate natures make terrible pilots. As a result, their ships suffer 25% dodge penalty

Cybernetic races have inorganic bodies and do not eat food, instead eating production. Production is a limited resource which slowly decays upon consumption. Cybernetic races are more mindful of production managements and needs.
Industrious races enjoy a 35% bonus to Production efforts due to their tireless and efficient natures
Lazy races just don't like to work, and as a result suffer a 35% penalty to Production efforts
Mercantile races are natural traders, and gain 0.5 Credits for each unit of food or production moved via freighter within the empire
Wasteful races lead lives of excess and care little for concepts like recycling or austerity. Ship and building maintenance costs 25% more
Efficient races earn a 25% reduction on ship and building maintenance costs due to their conservative and intelligent use of resources
Races with a strong tradition of political corruption have a 25% corruption penalty to tax income
Meticulous races honor the actuarial professions, earning a 25% bonus to tax income for their attention to details
Races with a natural engineering inclination build sturdier ship components, resulting in a 20% overall increase to ship module hit points
Races who follow haphazard ship construction techniques have shoddier equipment overall, earning a 20% penalty to module hit points
Races that have extensively studied the stars start the game with the closest 20 star systems fully explored
Races with strong naval traditions gain a 35% reduction to ship building costs due to having well developed economic practices concerning ship construction
Races with strong military traditions are prepped and ready to meet alien threats. As a result, they begin the game with the Military Outpost, Armor Theory, and Corvette Hull technologies.
Races that have been foolish enough to heavily pollute their own homeworld have a -0.5 Fertility penalty on their homeworld, making quick colonization a top priority
The racial homeworld is much larger than the average planet, allowing 25% more population maximum
The racial homeworld is much smaller than the average planet, allowing 25% less population maximum
Begin the game with an advanced prototype flagship equipped with technologies that otherwise would not be available at the game's start

Pre-Warp races discovered an ancient alien vessel buried in the polar ice of their homeworld. They begin the game with a powerful alien cruiser, but possess no star faring technologies and no starbase for ship construction
Races possessing a pioneering spirit believe that their destiny lies out among the stars. As a result, your passenger transports carry three times as many colonists to new planets
Attack Runs: \n\nShip will make head-on attack runs on its target

Maximum Range: 

Ship will rotate so that forward-firing weapons are facing its target. 
If in a fleet, it will attempt to maintain formation. If not, ship will maneuver to within maximum weapons range. 
If a carrier the ship will use the Carrier Hangar range.
Ship will maneuver to keep its target on the port side
Ship will maneuver to keep its target on the starboard side
Ship will attempt to maintain formation and facing at all times
A measure of how cooperative a ship is; the weight given to targeting ships that are being targeted by allies
A measure of how protective a ship is; the weight given to targeting ships that are targeting friendly ships
A measure of how opportunistic a ship is; the weight given to targeting ships that are damaged
The weight given to targeting ships that are heavily armored
The weight given to targeting ships that are heavily shielded
The weight given to targeting ships that have a high Damage Per Second output
Defines the area in which a ship will seek targets to attack or defend
Determines whether a ship prefers targets smaller, similar, or larger than itself

Allows you to customize an "Area of Operations" or "AO" for a freighter. Freighters will only trade within their AO (both Manual and Auto Trade), allowing you to define custom trade areas. Drag a selection box around the area of the galaxy you want to define as the AO. You can define more than one AO per ship. Right click the AO to delete it. Esc key or right clicking on this button will exit AO creation mode.

Send Troops to this ship if it's troop number is less than the maximum or less than 25% if in combat. If you toggle this off, the ship will go to resupply when it has no troops left. A ship set to Kamikaze will not retreat to resupply, but will request troops if the button is on.
When active, all available fighters will launch and escort the carrier. If not active, fighters will launch only for combat and return to their hangars for resupply when combat ends.

Indicates how much food this planet will produce per assigned colonist per turn (a turn is 0.1 StarDate). Some building or environmental effects might increase or decrease the maximum value, in which case the current value will gradually match the max value over time. The number in parentheses indicates the fertility modifier of this colony, based on your empire's suitable environments. Fertility above 1 can boost buildings which grand food per assigned colonist as they will serve as a multiplier. Non Cybernetic Races consume food.
Indicates how much research this planet will produce per assigned colonist per turn (a turn is .1 StarDate)

Mark this planet for colonization. If you own a colony ship that has no current mission then it will be assigned to colonize this planet. Otherwise, a new colony ship will be constructed at your best available shipyard and dispatched to this planet upon completion
Cancel the colonization mission that is underway for this planet
Indicates that your empire has a mission underway to colonize this planet
Indicates this ship's current power supply and maximum power capacity
Indicates the total power of all of this ship's shields as well as the maximum shield power total across all shields
Indicates this ship's current stores of ordnance and its maximum ordnance capacity
Indicates this ship's current defense versus boarding actions. If this ship is boarded by enemy infantry and this number is reduced to zero, then the ship will be lost

Indicates this colony's total strength versus ground invasions. Strength is determined by the number of troops garrisoned here as well as by any defensive buildings on the ground. If this planet is invaded and the defensive strength is reduced to 0, then the invaders will capture this colony

Orders all bomb-equipped ships in the vicinity of this planet (Range 15000) to begin bombarding the planet. Or, if they are already bombarding the planet, to cancel their bombardment. The number in brackets is the available bombers for this action. The button's color will be Red if you are currently bombing the planet.
Indicates this unit's ground combat strength. A unit's strength corresponds both to its hitpoints and to its effectiveness in making an attack

Indicates this unit's combat effectiveness versus Soft targets such as infantry. For each point of a unit's strength, it has a percentage chance equal to its Soft Attack to inflict 1 point of damage onto a soft target

Indicates this unit's combat effectiveness versus Hard targets such as buildings and armored units. For each point of a unit's strength, it has a percentage chance equal to its Hard Attack to inflict 1 point of damage onto a hard target.

Opens a panel displaying any troops you have in orbit, whether they are on shuttles. If this is your colony and you have a space port, troops garrisoned in ships (even if these ships do not have assault bays), they will be displayed here as well. You can drag a troop from this list to available tiles to land it or just double click on it to land it on a random tile.

Indicates the number of troops stationed on this ship (Green for your troops, Red for other troops) and this ship's maximum troop capacity. If the Ship has Assault bays, you will see the number of available assault shuttles in Blue.

This represents how fully your agents have penetrated a foreign government. The more thoroughly you have penetrated an enemy government, the more you will know about their status.
Furthermore, you can spend intelligence penetration points to launch espionage "Operations"

The more you spend on your espionage budget for this empire, the quicker your intelligence penetration will rise.
An empire's counter-espionage budget reduces your intelligence penetration
Your counter-espionage budget reduces the penetration of enemy agents from all empires
Activate your intelligence assets to discover and remove an enemy agent such as a mole or a saboteur within your empire
Use your agents to stir up diplomatic conflict between target empire and a random rival empire
Put an agent in place on a random enemy vessel. Gain sight of that vessel. This agent may be activated to attempt sabotage of ship's power plant
Activates all saboteurs simultaneously. The saboteurs will destroy the ship's largest power plant, likely crippling or destroying the vessel
Will steal a random technology that target empires possesses and you do not

This indicates how much a race trusts you. Trust determines how large of a deal a race is willing to make with you. You can earn trust in a number of ways, including giving gifts, keeping your agreements, and generally behaving in a trustworthy manner.

This indicates how angry a race is with you. They will become angry if you attack them or make unreasonable demands of them. They may also be angry for befriending their enemies or just because they simply are an angry race.
This indicates how much a race fears you based on the strength of your military and your deeds. Races that fear you may be willing to give concessions in trade that they may not otherwise give.

Add this item to the colony's build queue. Holding Shift will add it 5 times. Holding Ctrl will add it 10 times. The credits cost listed is the final credit cost of this item. The cost will be charged partially, as production progresses.
Edit this ship in the shipyard
Cancel production and remove this item from the construction queue. 50% of the production spent will be returned to the colony's storage, however, there will be no credit refund.
Opens the deep space building window which will allow you to place an order for a platform or other deep space structure
Opens the ships list, which allows you to browse, filter and control all the vessels under your command
Zooms to your currently selected ship
Zoom out to the galaxy view
Opens the automation panel which allows you to automate certain empire tasks
Opens the fleets screen which will allow you to create customized ship groups and formations
Open the Ground Assault View for this planet where you can land troops and order bombardments
Click to move up in the queue. Control-Click to move to the top
Click to move down in the queue. Control-Click to move to the bottom
Ship will attempt to hold position and will not move to engage enemies

Taxes are collected from your planets as a portion of their populations income. The negative side of taxes is that they reduce moral and productivity. For instance, a tax rate of 25% means that research and industrial output will be reduced by 25% across all planets. Production output reduction for Cybernetics is 50% of the tax rate.
Toggles whether this ship's assault shuttles should be launched and escort the troop ship or recovered to hangars
Right Click this troop to launch it in its shuttle
This planet's population is shrinking due to starvation!

This planet is manually exporting production. It will only allocate some percentage of it's net production to the build queue if freighters are exporting production from this planet. If there is no demand, it will allocate it's storage to the building queue as well.
This planet is manually importing production. Any storage available as well as any production produced here will be automatically applied to the construction queue
This planet is manually storing production. Only 50% of net production capacity will be allocated to the build queue, the rest will be stored, until the storage is full.
Drag a structure from the buildings construction list on the right to this tile to begin building an improvement here
This land is not habitable without first building a biosphere here to protect your colonists. Alternatively, researching and employing terraforming techniques will improve this planet's habitability
The landscape here is not suitable for habitation without the construction of advanced habitation modules. Building a biosphere here will make this area habitable
Governor will build agricultural buildings, importing production and exporting food. Labor focused entirely on agriculture.
Governor will build a balanced world to stand at the core of your empire.
Governor will focus entirely on maximizing production, importing food and exporting production. Labor focused entirely on industry.
Governor will build a limited infrastructure and focus instead on military production.
Governor will build a dedicated research colony, relying on imports for food and production.
You are managing this colony manually.

Governor will control production levels as a core system, but will not build any structures. It will start importing if stores are below 20% and continue importing until they reach 40%. It will start exporting if stores are above 80% and continue exporting until stores go down to 40%.
From orbit this appears to be an ancient and abandoned mine. It could be worth exploring this further.

Aeroponics is the use of a hydro-atomized spray to deliver nutrients to plants suspended in the air. This technique offers excellent plant growth and eliminates the need for soil while at the same time minimizing pathogen risks. +1 flat bonus to Food production.

Biospheres are special, highly adaptable living habitats. Biospheres may only be built on Uninhabitable terrain; in doing so, the terrain becomes habitable and the planet gains max population based on the half of the Colonists per Tile. Economic buildings can thereafter be built underneath the biosphere.
population cap; turns inhabitable tiles into habitable

The Capital City is a unique building that provides research while improving industrial and agricultural capacity. Capital Cities also provide excellent self defense and can withstand a sustained siege by determined opponents. Finally, Capital cities allow you to recruit basic infantry units.
A unique building at the heart of your empire
From orbit this appears to be the resting place of a crashed spaceship. Ground troops might be able to find out more by exploring.
The output of this Genetics Research Facility scales with the amount of colonists dedicated to the task, providing +.5 research per assigned colonist.

Gun Emplacements fire standard flak rounds and provide significant defensive bonuses to a planet in two ways. First, gun emplacements deal 1 guaranteed damage to each landing troop. Second, gun emplacements act as defensive units in ground invasions and are capable of performing moderate hard-target attacks.
The Imperial Bank building increases the efficiency of your planetary tax operations by 50%.
The Ion Defense Cannon is an extremely effective planetary defense weapon. It fires highly Ionized EM pulse rounds that can both damage and disable targeted ships.
Fires disabling Ion Blasts into orbit
This basic facility provides a barracks, armory, mess, firing range, and other facilities needed to train and equip infantry for ground combat.
This missile silo fires long range guided anti-ship missiles for maximum planetary defense.
Fires long range missiles into orbit
What wonders or horrors are lurking inside this mysterious tomb? Find out by sending an away team (a ground troop) to investigate.
This ancient alien mine has been cleared of its infestation and repaired to good use. It is an incredibly productive mine.

An Outpost building is the humble first step in a civilization's efforts to colonize a new world. Outposts provide for a base level of agricultural, industrial, and scientific capacity. When built on a barren planet, it is critical for an outpost to be supplemented with an aeroponic farm. Outposts are also capable of rudimentary self-defense in case of invasion.
Provides basic functions necessary for colonies
This massive installation projects an incredibly large energy shield into the upper atmosphere of a planet and provides substantial protection against planetary bombardments.
A dedicated research lab allows colonists to begin in earnest the study of their new home. Provides a flat +1 per turn research bonus to any colony.
Manned and automated rovers provide indispensable labor savings to fledgling colonies, increasing the production of the colony with a flat +1 production bonus.

These machines, while expensive to maintain, will tirelessly transform barren hunks of rock into livable worlds with breathable atmospheres. This building does not need to be built under a biosphere. Terraformers will first make terrformable parts of the planet Habitable, and then slowly transform the planet to a heaven for your Empire. After the planet was terraformed, any remaining biospheres over tiles which were terraformed will be removed to complete the process. The number of Terraformers which can be placed on a planet is affected by the number of tiles which can be terraformed and it is dynamically reduced during the terraforming operation.
Terraforms the planet to your preferred Environment
These massive subspace telescopes greatly increase a colony's default sensor range.
A simple building with a simple purpose, the warehouse provides an environmentally controlled facility where 100 extra food and production can be stored.
Xeno mines are the first real step towards exploiting a planet's mineral deposits, creating +1 production per colonist assigned to industrial tasks.

Although steel armor is inexpensive, it is extremely heavy and reduces the maneuverability of our ships significantly. By focusing our research efforts on developing new construction materials, we can reduce the mass of all of our ship components across the board.
New materials reduce effective ship mass by 10% across the board.

Colonizing barren planets or planets with a low fertility score means that food production will be critical to that colony's survival. Aeroponic farming techniques provide a basic level of sustenance to support a small colony.
This technology was recovered from an ancient ship.
This technology was recovered from an ancient ship.
This technology was recovered from an ancient ship.
This technology was recovered from an ancient ship.

By stabilizing a matter / anti-matter reaction, we can harness the energy output for a massive increase to our power levels. For now, we require a large reaction chamber, but future advances may miniaturize this process.
The benefits of armoring our spaceships are self-evident. The use of steel is already common in our planetary industries, and so it is quite inexpensive to adapt this technology for use in space.
We have reached our maximum genetic potential and require new genetic sources to continue growth.
Gain all of the positive genetic traits of any race conquered via ground invasion The planet has to have at least 2 Billion colonists for the assimilation to succeed.

Our most massive ships can deploy corvette-sized vessels as well as smaller frigates from these gargantuan berths. When these "battle raiders" are destroyed, however, there is no respawn until the mothership returns to a shipyard for resupply.
These massive ships are unrivaled for their size and cost.

Biospheres are large geodesic dome structures capable of supporting many colonists in an artificial environment. For a barren planet to house a large population, biospheres are absolutely necessary. Build biospheres on uninhabitable land to make that land habitable.

It is clear that financing a large interstellar empire is too large and too important a task to leave in the hands of non-government entities. With the government directly financing all expansion activities, we will reap the interest rewards and not private corporations.

Boldly going to strange new worlds is just the first step. What to do when we get there is quite a bit more important. This technology branch explores various scientific, industrial, and military enhancements we can make to our colonies.
Unlocks the Military Transport, a combat ready hull that can fill multiple roles.
Researching this technology will allow us to build certain armored components that can take more hits than their unarmored versions.

Cruisers are large, heavy ships that can serve in a number of offensive or defensive roles. Cruisers are often seen as the command ship for fleets of smaller frigates or fighter class vessels, and are large enough to house multiple fighter bays for carrier roles.

Cryogenics is the science of suspending an organism's life functions by freezing it. Even though cryogenics equipment is bulky, it is possible to transport many more people with cryogenics than without it.
Doubles the amount of colonists carried by passenger ships within your empire

When resource extraction matters more than the environment, Deep Core Mines are the solution. Deep Core mines will ruin all but the hardiest planetary ecosystems and are best suited for barren worlds.
The Disintegrator Array is a massively powerful beam weapon suitable only for a fixed spinal mount.

Disruptors Cannons are similar in function to Laser Cannons -- an ionized packet of high-energy plasma is shot from the cannon. However, the disruptor payload is engineered with a denser and much more volatile plasma charge.
Electronic Counter Measures such infrared and subspace frequency jammers can confuse enemy point defense sensors into missing their targets.
Grants missile weapon (such as rockets, guided missiles, and torpedoes) a 25% chance to dodge intercepting fire.

EMP Cannons are used to disable targeted ships by overloading their power grids with random energy. All ships have a natural EMP defense based on their size. EMP weapons are ineffective against shielded targets.
Electromagnetic pulse torpedoes deliver a massive shock to an area of effect that includes friendly targets. If this blast overwhelms a ship's EMP defenses, the ship will be stunned for 3 seconds.

"Laser" Cannons are somewhat of a misnomer because the cannon in fact fires an ionized magnetic shell filled with superheated plasma. The cannon gains its name because the plasma is heated by laser before being magnetically accelerated and shot towards its target.

Many of our top military scientists believe that directed energy weapons are the future of space combat. Other scientists favor the encapsulation of various energies into ionized packets, creating energy "cannons". This technology represents our first steps into this field.
The technology branch explores power creation and energy fields, with applications both industrial and military.

Energy shields are a requirement for any Captain expecting to engage in combat. These devices extend an absorbent energy field towards projectiles entering its sphere of protection. Shields 'recharge' by shedding the energy captured. Shields vary in strength, recharge rate, and protection radius

Some fleet commanders question the prudence of shielding fighters, believing it to be a waste of resources for a disposable asset. Even so, there is no quesiton that a fighter with a shield is better than one without, and perhaps other uses can be found for these small shields.

As our ability to build larger ships improves, we can begin to build motherships capable of providing berths to smaller ships. Ultimately, we envision large cruisers capable of deploying dozens of fighters or bombers into a combat situation. Note that carrier ship capabilities will increase the carrier's maintenance cost, as the fighters there need to be maintained as well.
For a fleet on extended deployment, running out of ammunition can be a major problem. Supply ships have therefore been an integral part of large fleet actions since the dawn of the naval age.
With investment into frigate construction, we can begin to build heartier ships that are more prepared for whatever dangers are out there than our comparatively flimsy cargo ships.

This technology will switch all of your ships' dedicated power cells over to the newer Deuterium standard. Deuterium cells can hold 20% more power than a standard cell, which translates into longer effective range for ships as well as greater energy pools available for combat systems.
Gain an empire-wide 20% bonus to the amount of power that is stored in dedicated power cells

Iridium has proven itself the superior element for power storage purposes. This technology switches all of your empire's dedicated power cells to the Iridium standard, increasing dedicated power cell efficiency by a total of 50%.
The fusion beam directs two narrow streams of atomic particles at a convergence point, where the atoms are fused and the energy is released. The result is a high-powered beam weapon.
Our understanding of genetics is blossoming to the point where we have almost total control over our own DNA.
Gain a 25% super solider bonus to all troop strengths
To engage larger enemy threats we need to upgrade our current missile technology to have longer ranges and increased payloads
Heavy weapons squads are better equipped and are more effective against hard targets than regular space marines.
This hull represents our first effort at a combat ready hull. It is larger and sleeker than our shuttlecraft hull and is capable of filling the role of a heavy scout or fighter.
Heavy shields are twice as large and can take 10 times the hits than a basic 1k shield model. However, the power cost for a shield like this is substantial.

Building a colony literally involves a lot of heavy lifting, and a lot of raw materials. This technology allows a colony to utilize manned and automated rovers to do the heavy lifting. Additionally, this technology allows a colony to build a warehouse to increase its maximum possible storage of food and production.

Inertial Damper systems effectively lower the mass of a ship by enveloping it in a weak subspace field. Lower ship mass translates to higher speed and greater handling. This process is very power-hungry, however.
Boldly go where no one has gone before, explore strange new worlds, meet new civilizations, and invade their homeworlds with power armor. This research tree can make that a reality.
A starship is a complicated web of interdependent systems, and the bigger they are the harder they are to control. This technology brings command and engineering functions in to the next generation.

Ion stream particle weapons have the unique effect of causing a target ship's capacitors to discharge. The result is a beam weapon that drains a target's power stores. However, Ion weapons are completely ineffective against shielded targets.
Managing a space empire is a major logistical task, requiring advanced coordination between the public and private sector over vast distances and spans of time.
Unlock the largest cargo hull possible.
Socio-Logistics is a broad term for studies that increase the social and economic efficiency of our empire and fleets
You may scrap and refit your ships.
Firing weapons using powder charges alone is inefficient. By adding a magnetic push to our projectiles we can put more ordnance on target in a more efficient manner.
Allows the construction of larger cargo ships, which can move more goods and passengers.
Trade is a vital component in any economy. By investing in our private economy, we can profit by taxing trade in our empire.
Every unit of Food or Production moved via transport within your empire is taxed by current tax rate and this tax is added to our empire money.
A military presence is a crucial first step on a colony's journey to relevance. This building allows you to train infantry-class troops at your colony.
We can substantially increase the survivability of our missile-based weaponry by protecting our missiles with armor plating.
Increases the hitpoints of missile-based weaponry by 25%.
Adapting missile technology to the rigors of space travel is not overly difficult. We can pursue further advances to missile propulsion, payload, and durability.
With Nanoweave Metallurgy, metal sheets are constructed one molecule at a time by a swarm of nanites. This results in a metal that is absolutely free of imperfections.
Provides a 10% hit point bonus to all ship modules
Phasors are extremely efficient directed energy weapons capable of longer and more powerful firing bursts.

By packing matter and anti-matter into separate magnetic compartments, the photon cannon can launch an explosive projectile a substantial distance. Upon impact, the chambers are merged and the matter/anti-matter explosion occurs.
While photons themselves are completely harmless particle waves of light, the matter/anti-matter detonation caused by a photon projectile is in fact quite destructive.
Physics is the language of the universe. By mastering physics, we master the universe.
Gain the ability to build subspace projector platforms in deep space.
It is wise to improve our planetary defense abilities with weapons that can deter invaders. A series of giant ground-based cannons should be a good start.

Surprisingly, shielding an entire planet is easier than shielding an entire ship because we needn't worry about mass, size, and power restrictions when building on terra firma. The result is a massive and powerful shield that provides protection from bombardment.
If we channeled highly-ionized Plasma directly from a ship reactor through a magnetized, high-pressure system, then we could spray our enemies with super-heated energy to devastating effect.

Phased polaron cannons encapsulate their payloads in a phased energy shell rather than an ionized magnetic shell, granting the projectile the ability to phase directly through shields. The unstable phased energy shell results in a lower effective range on these weapons.
Privatization allows private entities to own shares in public operations, therby subsidizing the maintenance costs for freighters and deep space installations.
Platform and Freighter maintenance is reduced by 50%
We believe that encountering Electromagnetic Pulse weaponry is distinctly possible. As a result it would be prudent to have defensive measures prepared for that eventuality.
The ultimate in cannon weaponry, this weapon fires extremely powerful energy torpedoes at a high energy cost.

We have been able to clone things for a long time but we have not been able to increase the maturation rate until now. With this technology we can raise a clone to adult maturity in weeks rather than years.

The reaction drive channels strongly ionized plasma through a subspace field which excites and unleashes the potential energy held within. The resulting torrent can be harnessed and redicted for propulsion purposes.
By converting all of our engines to the reaction drive standard, we can achieve 20% faster sub-light speeds and maneuverability.

Each new colony presents a fresh opportunity for scientific discovery, be it biological, geological, archeological, or otherwise. Basic scientific facilities are critical to understanding our new homes and increasing our knowledge of the universe.
Feeding, housing, and equipping marines in deep space requires precise logistical planning. Marines can carry assaults out on enemy vessels if their ship is equipped with an assault shuttle bay.

Siphon beams create a connection between the firing ship and the target ship's energy shields. The beam depletes the shield energy and transfers is into the firing ship's power stores. The weapon is ineffective otherwise.
By focusing subspace manipulations at an area in front of a nearby ship, a subspace projector can effectively "plow" subspace, if only for a moment, to increase a local ship's FTL speed.
Ships traveling within your own empire's borders gain 20% bonus to their FTL speeds.

Taking a cue from naval tradition, early spacecraft rely heavily on bullets, shells, flak, and other kinetic weapons. Their raw destructive power and relative cheapness make them an excellent value, though they do require ammunition. Research into energy weapons will provide our empire with weapons suitable for longer deployments. We can also focus our efforts on developing spaceworthy self-guided missile technologies.

A core of basic starship design knowledge was needed for us to even begin reaching into the stars. This core technology represents having discovered basic starship command, propulsion, and hull technologies.

Our scientists have concluded that conventional weapons, when packed with enough high explosives, can rival even the most modern energy weapons for raw destructive power. Accelerate this explosive using subspatial techniques and you have a very massive cannon.

The ability to package light-speed communications into a faster-than-light subspace packet allows for near instantaneous communication over great distances. This discovery has profound implications for deep space scanning.
By focusing subspace manipulations at an area in front of a nearby ship, a subspace projector can effectively "plow" subspace, if only for a moment, to increase a local ship's FTL speed.
Ships traveling within your own empire's borders gain 20% bonus to their FTL speeds.

We have known for a long time that forces beyond our observable reality have an effect on our observable reality. With a deeper understanding of subspace theory, we can begin to benefit from practical applications of this knowledge.
Increase effective StarDrive speeds by 20% for all ships in your empire

We have discovered that the efficiency of traveling through subspace is affected by the shape of a ship's subspace bubble. This technology allows for the construction of subspace "plows", which manipulate that shape to increase a ship's speed at warp.
The power penalty incurred by ships at warp is reduced by 20%
Grants a 50% bonus to empire FTL speeds
Enemy Ships cannot warp inside your territory using conventional subspace methods.
Tachyons are particles that move substantially faster than the speed of light. By retuning our sensors to detect Tachyons we can substantially increase their effectiveness.
Doubles the range of all sensors
There's nothing like a good dose of face-melting Thalaron radiation to weaken a space marine's resolve and cellular cohesion. Very useful for pre-boarding volleys.

These ultra-massive ships are the absolute pinnacle of spaceship construction. These hulking behemoths are almost impractically slow and large, but their firepower and defensive potential is enormous.
A torpedo is essentially a massive missile, loaded to the brim with high explosives. It trades speed and maneuverability for payload.
Tractor beams create a miniature point singularity that effectively increases the mass of the targeted ship, slowing it down. Tractor beams are only half as effective against shielded targets.
Our computer scientists believe that they can apply the lessons learned while studying other languages to improve our computing efficiency substantially.
Applies knowledge of alien languages to computing sciences, granting a +10% research bonus for your empire.

Spacefaring races typically possess sufficient computing and linguistic sciences to "shake hands" on a workable trade speech in a matter of minutes. But the nuance of language can be lost in this translation and there are also those rare occasions where a language is so foreign that our computers cannot decipher it at all.
Unlocks the ability to understand truly foreign creatures that you might encounter
A more nuanced understanding of alien languages provides a 10% bonus to diplomatic efforts

Farming on many alien planets isn't as simple as planting some seeds and adding water. In fact, many planets that are technically quite fertile are nevertheless rich with nutrients that are incompatible with or even toxic to our crops and animals. Xeno Farming helps overcomes these problems.

By studying alien plants, animals, and microganisms, we have learned many new genetic secrets. By applying some of what we have learned to our own bodies, we are able to live much longer and healthier lives.
Gain an empire-wide 25% bonus to population growth from increased lifespans
With the proper industrial foundations laid, exploitation of an alien world's mineral resources can begin in earnest.
This is an ancient but powerful anti-matter reactor.
A very old and very powerful repulsor weapon that acts as a sort of reverse tractor beam.
An ancient yet very advanced small shield generator. It has twice the output of our best 2 x 2 designs.
Fuel cells capture and store power from a ship's powerplant, increasing the ship's effective operational range as well as its stamina in combat.

This monstrous cannon fires fast-moving, high explosive shells. It consumes considerable ordnance to fire this weapon but its power is unquestionable. That said, only a few ships are large enough to mount this weapon.
The bridge is the nerve center of a starship, providing basic sensor functionality, damage control, and life support for a moderate sized crew.
This massive engine will provide awesome thrust at an awesome power cost.

The combat information center consolidates all command and control functions into a single module. From here the crew can coordinate sensor data, manage damage control teams, organize shipboard defensive actions, and more.
This cockpit has enough room for a small flight crew and their workstations. From here, the crew can receive basic sensor data, coordinate ship repairs, and pilot the ship.
This torpedo tube launches slow-moving but devastating torpedos packed to the hilt with explosives. They require substantial ordnance to fire and can be intercepted by point defense weapons.
This massively powerful directed energy weapon strikes fear into the hearts of capital ship commanders everywhere.
A crude but effective high-energy cannon weapon
A crude but effective high-energy cannon weapon
This torpedo tube launches slow-moving but devastating torpedoes packed to the hilt with explosives. They require substantial ordnance to fire
A turret mounted EMP cannon weapon, useful for disabling enemy ships, provided their shields are down.
Twin EMP cannons mounted on a turret platform with advance cooling systems for rapid and sustained fire. Not effective against targets who's shields are still active.
This basic engine provides ample thrust for a moderate energy cost. The maximum speed and maneuverability of a ship is directly related to a ship's thrust to mass ratio.

This hangar bay supports a single fighter-class ship at a time. If the fighter is destroyed in combat, it will respawn from this bay after a cooldown. You may designate which of your fighter designs launches from this bay in the ship design screen
This is a medium-sized engine. It is more efficient than using four smaller engines in every way.
This medium-sized fuel cell is heavily armored, with triple hitpoints but an increased cost and reduced fuel capacity.
This armored fuel cell is reinforced with triple hitpoints at the expense of increased mass and cost and slightly reduced fuel capacity.
This heavy-mount fusion beam has a fixed spinal facing and a 45 degree field of fire.
Fusion particle beams gain increased damage over laser beams but are much less efficient. This particular model is mounted on a swivel to achieve a 45 degree field of fire.
This is a heavier variant of the standard laser cannon. Its increased size allows for the creation and delivery of a higher-energy laser pulse.
This is a power hungry subspace field generator that effectively lowers the mass of any ship in which it is installed. Lower mass translates to higher top speeds and maneuverability.
This Ion beam drains power from the targeted vessel, provided that their shields are down.
This turret-mounted Ion beam drains a moderate amount of power from the targeted ship, provided that its shields are down.
This piece of ancient hardware mimics modern designs for planet-based Ion Cannons, except that it is incredibly minitaturized. These specifications were obviously copied from an advanced race.
This turret-mounted laser beam has a limited range and is useful in point defense roles
This weapon is a laser cannon mounted on a swivel turret to provide a 90 degree field of fire.
This weapon is a heavy laser cannon mounted on a swivel turret for wide angle coverage

These cramped quarters provide enough living space for a single platoon of marines. Marines increase a ship's boarding defense and can also be used offensively if their ship has an assault shuttle. Marines receive any racial ground combat bonuses or penalties.

This barracks houses 4 Marine platoons. Marines increase a ship's boarding defense and can also be used offensively if their ship has an assault shuttle. Marines receive any racial ground combat bonuses or penalties.
Fuel cells capture and store power from a ship's powerplant, increasing the ship's effective operational range as well as its stamina in combat.
This long range anti-ship missile is as agile as it is strong, and can make short work of ships with poor point defense systems.
A twin missile launcher on a swivel turret allows cruiser-class vessels to dominate the battlefield with overwhelming missile barrages.
This is a multiple rocket launching system housed on a swivel turret for an enhanced field of fire.

A bomb bay that allows a ship to strike a planet with low-yield tactical nuclear bombs. The Target planet will suffer temporary reduction to its Fertility level. Constant bombing might permanently reduce fertility and even change the plant climate forever.
Reactors are the beating hearts of spaceships. This basic fission model provides a moderate level of power output and power storage. Explodes when destroyed.
Power Plants are the beating hearts of spaceships. This basic fission model provides a moderate level of power output and power storage. Explodes when destroyed.

Ordnance represents a ship's stores of munitions and explosives such as bullets, missiles, torpedoes, mines, and other special weapons. A basic ordnance locker such as this one provides a captain with a safe and convenient place to store his munitions.

An ordnance supply bay allows a ship to launch supply shuttles filled with ammunition to resupply friendly ships. Only one shuttle may be active per bay at a time. Supply shuttles can ferry 100 ordnance at a time.
This heavy-mount phasor array has a fixed spinal facing and a 45 degree field of fire.
Phasors are powerful and efficient directed energy weapons.
A turret mounted photon cannon weapon, highly effective in any combat situation.
Twin photon cannons mounted on a turret platform with advance cooling systems for rapid and sustained fire.
This weapon is best used at low speeds and close ranges. Higher speeds cause the plasma to disperse ineffectively, and the weapon is simply useless at range. But up close, it is devastating.
Plasteel armor provides approximately 25% less protection than steel armor but does so with half of the mass
Plasteel armor provides approximately 25% less protection than steel armor but does so with half of the mass
Plasteel armor provides approximately 25% less protection than steel armor but does so with half of the mass.
A turret mounted polaron cannon weapon. Bypasses shields.
Twin polaron cannons mounted on a turret platform with advance cooling systems for rapid and sustained fire. Bypasses shields.
Carries power across a ship over a large area.

This is an inexpensive but bulky electromagnetic capacitor. Any ship equipped with pulse capacitors will be substantially more difficult to disable with electromagnetic pulse weaponry. They also help the ship recover faster from EMP overloads
This is a fixed-mount railgun suitable for more agile ships. It has excellent range and is very efficient for its size.
This weapon is a heavy-mounted rail gun that can propel an explosive projectile an impressive distance.
The mysterious aliens known as the Remnant have advanced power technologies such as this capacitor.
The mysterious Remnant race have advanced power generation capabilities, including this spectacular small power plant.
This rocket launchers stores and fires light guided rockets.
This siphon beam rapidly draws power from enemy shields to replenish our own power stores.
This turret-mounted siphon beam is useful for depleting enemy energy shields to increase our own power stores.

This large slab of steel armor is forged as a single seamless unit, which provides greater protection than a series of smaller armor slabs. Steel armor is cheap and durable, with its primary drawback being its weight.
This is a medium-sized slab of thick steel armor. It is cheap and heavy but provides significant protection.
This is a small plate of thick steel armor. It is cheap and heavy but provides significant protection.
This titanic engine requires considerable power but provides unparalleled thrust.
This heavy tractor beam can slow even the mightiest vessels.
This turret-mounted tractor beam is useful for slowing fast moving ships to make them easier targets.

This hangar bay will launch an assault shuttle capable of performing a ship-to-ship boarding action. A ship that launches an assault shuttle will have its Boarding Defense lowered by the power of the troops leaving the ship for the assault. Only one shuttle per bay may be launched at a time.

The Vulcan cannon is a small, rapid fire machine gun capable of shredding lightly armored targets in a storm of uranium-tipped rounds. Point Defense weapons automatically engage incoming missiles and have bonus damage versus missile weapons.
This warp engine provides twice the benefit of a normal engine for warp purposes, but only half the thrust of a normal engine at sublight speeds.
This medium-sized warp engine provides greater warp performance at the expense of sublight performance.
A ship that requires more strategic mobility than tactical mobility would do well to install this massive warp engine.
A massive warp engine for a massive ship.
This teleporter device will automatically remove Ordnance stored on the equipped ship and beam it to nearby ships in need of ammunition.
This Bomb launcher delivers an energy-based explosive to planetary surfaces, foregoing the need for Ordnance.

The lush vibrance of this oceanic paradise is evident even from orbit. Scans reveal incredible biodiversity in the oceans and on the few large islands poking up from the depths.

It is an extremely fertile world with a wide range of habitates and climates. From orbit you can see majestic mountains soaring above the clouds. Turquoise oceans glimmer in the sunlight, and scans reveal that the planet's many forests are teeiming with life. This planet is a rare gem.
It is an extremely fertile world. Its oceans and forests teem with life, its soil is rich with nutrients, and the climate is perfectly suited to agriculture.

The combination of extreme heat and extreme humidity have turned this planet into a sauna world. Scans reveal a dizzying amount of life on this planet and a colony could thrive here if the colonists could adapt to the heat and the mud.

While this is unquestionably a fertile and vibrant planet, it is just a little too cool to be called a garden world. Scans show that the oceans are cold and rough but filled with life and the landmasses are suitable for agriculture. Life could be good here.

Mountains, deserts, tundras, forests, oceans, and many other environments drift past your viewports. Life has found many different ways to survive and thrive on this planet and there is no question that it would make an extraordinary home for colonists.
It has ample natural resources and can easily sustain a large population. Its soil is adequate for agricultural purposes and the climate allows a suitable growing season.

Dunes of sun-scorched sand rise and fall over the landscape like ocean waves. From orbit, you can see dozens of frenzied storms whirling the sands around at lethal speeds. There are no sources of liquid water exposed to the sky. Life on this planet would be possible, but it would be harsh.

Scans reveal that this planet is a shadow of what it may once have been, or perhaps could have been. The oceans are surprisingly infertile, perhaps due to a thinner atmosphere than what would be optimal. The land-masses are mostly coral atolls or volcanic protrusions. It is not an inhospitable world but neither is it a vibrant one.

However, scans reveal geothermal activity beneath the surface and surprising biodiversity in the waters beneath the ice. With a thin but functional atmosphere, it would be possible for colonists to eek out a living on this planet. Whether or why they would want to is another question entirely.

This planet appears lush and green from orbit, but upon closer inspection, scans reveal that it is in fact entirely covered in an aggressive and resilient strain of algae. Claiming land to farm here would be an uphill battle.

This planet's eco-system is divided between the steppe-dwelling creatures that reside on the planet surface and the canyon-dwelling creatures that live in the deep fissures carved through the landscape.

A cool planetary temperature and a layer of permanently frozen subsoil prevents this planet from developing a truely thriving ecosystem. Even so, life has found a way here. Fish swim in the frigid seas and herd animals roam the landscape in search of food. Living here is possible, but not for the faint of heart.

It appears that some ecological disaster has rendered this planet less habitable that it could potentially have been. Thick cloud cover has cooled this planet and dampened the development of life. It is possible to live off of the land here, but it would be difficult.
It has a difficult but habitable environment, and while it is perfectly capable of supporting basic agriculture, population growth would be somewhat stymied here.
Toxic gases permeate the atmosphere and magma flows across the landscape in great rivers. Enormous volcanos spew ash and fire into the sky on every horizon.
Its atmosphere is comprised largely of hydrogen and helium, with trace amounts of methane. This planet's superheated liquid mantle make it unsuitable for colonization.

With no atmosphere to speak of and a temperature only a few degrees above absolute zero, this planet is extraordinarily treacherous to advanced life-forms. Pools of liquid helium and massive boulders of frozen hydrogren mark the landscape. Surface agriculture would be totally impossible here.

This planet's rough terrain and harsh climate would provide great difficulties to the unprepared settler. There are few plots of arable land and water is only found deep in the fissures that are cut through the planet's surface.
Large, lifeless plains dominate the landmasses. Terrible winds and storms rage all over the globe. What little water there is remains frozen except near the equator. Life here would be difficult.

Dunes of sun-scorched sand tower over the landscape like tidal waves frozen in time. The entire globe seems covered in sand-storms. Orbital scanners can find no traces of water or plant life. This is a cursed world, and only the bravest, or the stupidest, would colonize here.

Gas giants like this planet typically serve as excellent sources of the various gases needed for science and industry. Their atmospheres, however, tend to be extremely hostile. Only the most specialized equipment can survive inside the planet's atmosphere.
The atmosphere here is very thin and as a result, radiation levels are somewhat high. The soil is composed of inorganic dust and sand that is not suitable for agriculture.

The life cycle on this planet has adapted in response to the regular, high-intensity electrical storms which wrack this planet. While farming here in the traditional manner is not possible, cultivation of native species would be moderately viable.
Colonization of this planet is simply not possible given its geological disposition.
scans reveal that this is an extremely mineral rich planet, with many valuable ore veins located very close to the planet's surface. Mining would be easy here.
scans reveal that this planet is relatively mineral rich and mining here will produce excellent results.
scans reveal that this planet has an average abundance of mineral wealth and mining here will produce good results.
Scans reveal that this is an extremely mineral rich planet, with many valuable ore veins located very close to the planet's surface. Mining would be easy here.
is relatively mineral rich and mining here will produce good results.
has an average abundance of mineral wealth and mining here will produce decent results.
suffers from a lack of useful minerals that are easily accessible. Mining is possible here but it will be hard work to extract valuable ores.
lacks significant veins of valuable minerals and would make a poor planet for a mining operation.
A solitary outpost has taken root here.

While all of the economic activity on the planet is centered in and around the outpost, even now the more intrepid colonists are staking their claims to the vast amount of unsettled land outside its perimeter.
Vast biodome complexes stand ready for an influx of new colonists and new economic activity. This barren world may yet thrive.
The harshness of this planet's climate has restricted growth beyond the outpost's perimeter for the time being, but plans are already underway to expand the outpost with extensive biodome complexes.
The barren landscape beyond the outpost's perimeter is completely incapable of supporting life. Even so, plans are already underway to expand the outpost with extensive biodome complexes.
This colony is well on its way to independence and success. The original outpost is now but one of several important economic centers on the planet.
Even so, there is still much more room for this planet to grow, and colonists are eager to mark their claims to the unsettled lands.
In fact, habitable land here is now running somewhat scarce, and the colonists are clamorouing for habitat expansions.
This is a vibrant colony with many billions of inhabitants. Several large cities serve as the commercial and industrial hubs.
Even so, there is still plenty of room for the colony to grow, and there are massive plans underway to continue expanding this planet's infrastructure.
In fact, habitable land here is now running somewhat scarce, and the colonists are clamorouing for habitat expansions.
With a vibrant economy and a huge population, this planet has moved beyond colony status and is now considered a homeworld of many billions of citizens.

This densely populated planet is covered with megacities and suburbs from one end of the globe to the other. It is a flourishing world of science and industry, though its once-majestic wilderness has all bit disappeared in the wake of development.
This planet is particularly notable for its fine ship-building industry.
This planet is well known for its thriving agricultural industry.
The quality of the universities and research institutions of this planet are well-known throughout the galaxy.
This planet is heavily fortified and has a strong military culture.

As your troops approach the mine entrance, they see clearly that this machinery, while ancient, is still in excellent shape. Unfortunately, a nest of Antlions has made its home here and your troops find themselves surrounded by foes very suddenly.

Your forces examine the wreckage of what is clearly a very, very ancient shipwreck. Time and nature have taken their toll on the wreckage. Even so, there are some curiosities among the wreckage that will have some value on the open market.

Here you have made a truly awesome discovery - what appeared from orbit to be a shipwreck was in fact not a wreck at all but a completely intact cruiser! What's more, it appears to be spaceworthy and your forces are taking it into orbit now.

Here you have made an excellent discovery - what appeared from orbit to be a shipwreck was in fact not a wreck at all but a completely intact alien light frigate! What's more, it appears to be spaceworthy and your forces are taking it into orbit now.

As your forces approach the downed vessel, they note that it is in surprisingly excellent shape. They are able to breach the hull through an airlock and they begin to explore the ship. They report finding an extremely odd piece of equipment in what they assume to be the engineering room. They take the equipment and leave. However, their presence has not gone unnoticed! Indigenous carnivores are attacking!

As your forces approach the downed vessel, they note that it is in surprisingly excellent shape. A weapon module extends out of the wreckage and they are able to detach it for further examination. They find nothing of interest in the rest of the ship. However, their presence has not gone unnoticed! Indigenous carnivores are attacking!

As your forces approach the downed vessel, they note that it is in surprisingly excellent shape. They are able to breach the hull through an airlock and they begin to explore the ship. They report finding an extremely odd piece of equipment in what appears to be a weapons station. They take the equipment and leave. However, their presence has not gone unnoticed! Indigenous carnivores are attacking!
Your forces enter the mysterious tomb and find evidence of a long dead civilization. The artifacts and other curiousities found there will sell well on the open market.

Your forces enter the mysterious tomb and find evidence of a long dead civilization. The complex is incredibly well preserved. Yet even more curious is the fact that this site seems to have been the target of an earlier archaeological expedition by a second alien race -- very likely starfarers based on the evidence found. \n \n The wealth of information presented here will pay dividends to our scientists for years to come. Your race gains a bonus to all scientific efforts for the discovery.

Your forces enter the mysterious tomb and find evidence of a long dead civilization. Deep within the tomb's halls they discover a mysterious artifact encased in some sort of energy shield. They disable the shield and take the artifact. \n \n Upon returning to the planet's surface, they find themselves surrounded by the skeletons of the long dead, seemingly animated by the same energy field that had encased the artifact!
This weapon has MIRV, meaning it will eject several warheads close to the target, mostly to ensure some of the warheads avoid interception. Damage and any modifiers you will see is per war head.

Maximum imprecision angle (in degrees) this weapon has. This is used in weapons such as vulcan cannons and plasma throwers. Gives the weapon a spray of shots.

build all ships now, prioritize them to be first in queue and apply continuous rush.\n \nWARNING: This might drain your Treasury in an alarming rate.
Use Shift + Click to bulk replace all similar modules. It is useful if you are upgrading your ship. It will also keep your old weapons' facing when bulk replacing weapons.

Armor Penetration enables this weapon to "bypass" armor on impact. The number indicates the size of the armor which can be penetrated (or combination of smaller sized armor). Some armor modules might have resistance to Armor Penetration. Golden color means that this value is modified from the original number.
The radius of the projectile's explosion. The number given is in slots. So 3 means 3 slots in every direction might be affected by the blast.
If checked, every time a ship in the fleet is destroyed, a new one will be created to fill the lines. The ship must be able to be built by your empire.

Normally, when you manually add a building to the colony's build queue, you will be notified when it is completed. You can disable these notifications, if you tend to manually build most of your buildings.
The best Colony Ship will be selected for construction if you have enable Auto Colonize or when you click on any Colonize buttons.
Indicates that this planet is unsafe for goods transportation, due to combat in the planet's orbit or manual Quarantine, and therefore no freighter will be until the Blockade or Quarantine is lifted.

This ship is inhibited and cannot engage warp. Check The red status symbol below for more details. You can disable this text and circle alerts in the Automation Screen. You can also enable gravity well display in the related button next to the Mini-map.
Inhibition Alerts are displayed when a single ship is selected and it is inhibited. Generally it is meant for Novice players and it will be off by default when starting a game on Hard or Brutal.
If checked, Remnant forces in the game will act as passive planet Guardians only.
Keep fixed credit cost of ships and military buildings for players regardless of difficulty level. This will make Hard and Brutal easier.

This Missile has Terminal Phase. This means that at the specified range, the missile will increase speed and will fly straight to the target. This makes it's interception harder.
This is the speed the missile accelerates to when Terminal Phase is initiated.

This Missile has delayed ignition, meaning it will slowly float during the time specified (in seconds) and then ignite it's engine. This makes it more vulnerable to interception when fired from short ranges.
Prevent goods transportation in and out of this planet. Useful for colonies in enemy territories with no safe passage. This overrides the Governor's Import/Export settings.
The Galaxy will be consisted of many small clusters, each empire will start in one of these clusters.
Each Empire starts in a cluster of solar systems for it to expand to before encountering other empires.

Strips the ship of any module but armor (or anything with deflection), shields, engines, and Command modules. Useful when using a template ship for a new design.

Planet type and Richness. The number in parentheses (if available) indicates the Fertility and Population modifiers of this planet, based on your empire's suitable environments.

Send available troops to this planet. Any available troop transports in space can be sent. Troops from your your nearest colony will be sent to this planet providing that the number of troops on that colony exceeds the Garrison Threshold.

Garrison Size ensures a number of troops always staying on the planet, regardless of any resupply requests from troop ships. You still have to train the troops manually, or check the "Build Garrison" Checkbox.
This indicates how many tiles are habitable on this planet
This indicates how much population is available per tile in millions, after any racial modifiers for that planet's environment. There is a minimum default population for the planet.
This indicates what would the maximum population of this planet be, if you built biospheres on all unhabitable tiles.

This indicates what would the maximum population of this planet be, if you fully terraformed this planet. This number might be the same as Biosphered Planet, but a Terraformed planet does not cost Biosphere maintenance.
This module has Self Regeneration Nano Technology and will repair itself with this amount per second as long as it is getting power.
Each of the ship shield's maximum power will be amplified by this number.

When powered, this amplifies the Maximum Power of the main shields in your ships. This number is also divided by the total number ofi main shields. Main shields are dedicated shield modules and appear under the "Shield" tab.
This is the strength of the ship divided by it's slot number. It is the actual value the empire uses to compare similar ships roles.

Treasury Goal is the target treasury amount for the empire. The various governors use this value to set their budgets. Warning: This is a percentage of a 20 year projection. This can cause massive empire overspending.

Population (in Billions) vs. Max Population available for your Empire. Percentage indicates how full the colony is. Lower Max Population than the current population means that the current Race occupying this planet is better suited to the environment than your Empire.

Normally, Governors operate within a budget limit which it tied to your empire's money and will start scrapping buildings if money becomes tight. Checking this box will not allow Governors to scrap buildings. You will have to be careful with your Money. Note that Governors will never scrap a building built personally by you.
Assign Planets to Trade route (Esc to exit)

Choose a list of planets that selected freighters will visit exclusively. At least 2 planets are needed, and may contain allied planets for exporting to. Left click a planet to add it, Right click to remove it. Click the button again or press ESC to return to play
Manual Trade: Allow selected freighters to trade with other empires. Right Click to turn it off. Note: Colonists cannot be traded between empires.
Build a Platform (the strongest your empire has available) orbiting this planet.The number in parentheses is the number of Platforms this planet already has in orbit.
Build a Station (the strongest your empire has available) orbiting this planet.The number in parentheses is the number of Stations this planet already has in orbit.
Build a Shipyard orbiting this planet.The number in parentheses is the number of Shipyards this planet already has in orbit.
Rebase a single troop from another planet or another free troop ship to this planet. You can send multiple troops, if available, that way.
Launch a single random troop from this planet to space. Note than you can launch any troop you want by left clicking on the troop icon in the grid below.
Land all troops listed in the orbital assets. The number in parentheses is the actual number which can currently land on this planet (free space)
Launch to space all troops which can currently move (total number in parentheses)

The Governor is exporting production. Only some percentage of it's net production will be allocated to the build queue if freighters are exporting production from this planet. If there is no demand or this planet is building more than 5 things, it will allocate it's storage to the building queue as well.

The Governor is importing production. If production freighters are on the way to this planet, it will allocate much of it's storage and net production to the build queue. If there are no available freighters or import, it store some of it's net production
The Governor is storing production. 50% of net production and storage capacity will be allocated to the build queue.

Create a Garrison force for the planet, based on the Garrison size you set. It will allow troops to be off-loaded below the Garrison size, and will train new troops to replace them. It will also auto build the cheapest building which can build Infantry, if able.
If Auto Trade is checked, the Best freighters available for your Empire will be built for import/export needs.

The Governor will build Stations, Shipyards, Platforms and Military Buildings based on the colony value to the Empire. It will also scrap them or upgrade them to better designs as they become available to your Empire. You will see a list of each orbital type (if your empire can build that type) below the colony grid specifying how many orbitals the planet has vs. how many the Governor is planning to have, based on colony value.
Indicates the tile range this troop can fire from. Veterans (level 5 or above) get +1 bonus to their range.

The number of Defense Ships hidden inside hangars on the planet's surface, piloted by aces. They will be scrambled and return home automatically for you, if you have enough money. You can control them only in battle.
EMP overload. Ship is disabled. When the number goes below 1, the ship has recovered from the EMP overload.
Structural Integrity of the ship reflecting internal damage. If this reaches 0%, the ship will be immediately destroyed.
When marked, this ship can only be assigned to a Carrier Hangar. It cannot be built by a colony. Drones are always assigned to a carrier hangar.
The planet's space offense vs incoming ships is listed here.
Every troop invading this planet will suffer the damage indicated here upon landing. This might destroy weak troops upon planet atmospheric entry.

This shows the hangar status of the ship. Green is the number of ships currently launched, White is the number of ships ready to launch and Red is the number of ships being rearmed, repaired or rebuit.
In order to complete your design and build it, you must fill all the ship's slots
A functional ship needs a command module (a cockpit, bridge, or CIC). It also must get power from the ship's reactors

You can switch from Normal Design mode to Symmetric Design mode, in which modules will be installed symmetrically (left and right) onto the ship, if possible. They will be also deleted together and their fire arcs will be adjusted to the opposite direction if you change them
The total time the ship can maintain energy weapon fire along with beams at peak power during beam duration time

This indicates that there is a net power drain from the ship's reserves (after considering power recharge) when all the ship's energy weapons, along with beams at full power, are persistently firing on targets, based on the weapons' power per second upon firing

This indicates that there is a net power drain from the ship's reserves (after considering power recharge) when all the ship's energy weapons are persistently firing on targets, based on the weapons' power per second upon firing

This weapon fires more than one projectile per shot. It will also fire this multiple projectiles per Salvo, if it has Salvo fire. A weapon with projectile count of 2 and salvo of 3, for instance, will fire 6 projectiles per salvo

The more complex the module is, the more it is harder to repair it. A complexity of 2, for instance, means that it will take twice the amount of time to repair the module. Complexity of 0.5 means it will be twice as fast to repair
This shield can recharge even during combat.

This modules explodes when destroyed, causing damage to nearby modules. The radius will get smaller as modules nearby absorb the explosion. The number is given as slots. So a Radius of 4 means around 4 slots will be affected from the explosion center.
The damage caused to nearby modules when this module is destroyed. Note that modules which soak the explosion also reduce the explosion damage.
Plasma Ordnance provides a 25% damage bonus to all of our Ordnance-based weapons.
By switching our Ordnance to a plasma-based standard, we can deliver a denser, higher-energy payload in our weapons for greater damage and effect.
Plasma Ordnance provides a 25% greater explosive radius to all of our Ordnance-based weapons.
Integration of hardened ship components reduces the effectiveness of explosion damage.
All ship modules are now slightly reinforced. Reducing radius of explosions by 25%.

When we accelerate our projectiles using a subspace field, we believe it is possible to initiate a subspace phase loop where the projectile's energy signature will rotate in and out of real space. If the projectile is phased into subspace when it would contact a shield, then the shield will ignore it because it cannot detect its energy signature.
Provides a 50% shield penetration chance to projectiles fired from Ballistic Cannons
Indicates a ship's experience level, up to a maximum of 5 stars. For each experience level, a ship gains a 5% bonus each to repair rate, turning speed, and weapons damage.
Our fighter pilots should be the best of the best. By investing in rigorous candidate screening and intense pilot training protocols, we can make our pilots the top guns in the galaxy.
All fighter class vessels receive 2 free experience levels.
Understanding an alien's language helps us understand how that alien thinks. Understanding how an alien thinks is the key to deceiving it.
Gain a +10 bonus to Defensive Agent rolls
Locks this slider, preventing the assigned labor percentage from being altered directly or indirectly.

Food is eaten by your colonists each turn. The number to the right of this slider indicates the net value of the food you are producing at this planet after the colonists have eaten. A negative value means that you are not producing enough food to cover your population's food needs. \n \n If your food production is negative and you do not have enough food in storage to cover your shortfall, then your population will begin to starve and die.
Production is required for the creation of ships, buildings, and troops. The number to the right of slider indicates your net production. Cybernetic races eat production rather than food.
Research points are added into an empire-wide pool where they are applied towards the top item in your research queue.

Indicates the amount of Food stored at this planet. Stored food can be eaten by your colonists here in times of need. Stored food may also be exported from this planet by freighters with the "Transport Goods" mission. \n \n You may designate whether this planet is importing, exporting, or storing Food by manipulating the button to the right of the storage indicator.

Indicates the amount of Production stored at this planet. Stored Production may be used to rush the production of any items in your build queue by clicking the appropriate icon next to the item in the queue. Stored Production may also be exported from this planet by freighters with the "Transport Goods" mission. \n \n You may designate whether this planet is importing, exporting, or storing Production by manipulating the button to the right of the storage indicator.

A colony's population is a primary indicator of its economic strength. The higher a colony's population, the more colonists are available to divide between the tasks of farming, production, and research. \n \n Population grows as a percentage of itself every turn, which means small colonies will grow very slowly compared to larger ones. To increase your population growth at a colony, build some freighters and assign them the "Transport Colonists" mission. These freighters will then bring colonists from your high-population worlds to your lower-population worlds.
This colony is set to export any excess food held in its food stores.
This colony is set to import food from other colonies and will be targeted by freighters with the Transport Goods mission.
This planet is neither importing nor exporting food. Any excess food created here will be stored for later use.
The occupants of this planet are cybernetic and have no need of food.

By reformulating the materials used in missile and ballistic weapons, we are able to create a sturdier projectile that will punch right through thinner armors, allowing our explosives to potentially reach the more vital innards of a ship.
Kinetic projectiles will pass through the first small-sized armor module encountered. The armor will take no damage.

This technology equips our ballistics with a small subspace field projector capable of producing a short-lived, tightly focused subspace field. At the moment of impact, the projector comes online and effectively lowers the density of any mass it encounters. This allows the projectile to penetrate even the thickest of armors.
Kinetic projectiles will pass through up to three slots worth of armor.

Dedicated orbital shipbuilding facilities will allow us to streamline our production process and provide large efficiency bonuses to our efforts. When built at a colony, a station will be placed in geosynchronous orbit (limited to 2 Shipyards per colony, 27 total orbital stytuctures). Stations may also be built in deep space. See the help menu for details.
This technology unlocks a unique "Shipyard" space station that boosts ship production by 25% at the planet where it is constructed. Each colony can support up to 2 Shipyards

Troops are an investment and we should protect that investment by providing medical facilities. These sickbay facilities can be placed on stations or larger ships and will slowly heal any troops stationed there. Multiple sickbays will have cumulative results.
food per turn per assigned colonist
Your people are cybernetic and have no use for organic food.

A ship's total mass determines its maneuverability and maximum velocity both at warp and at sublight speeds. Mass cannot be reduced below the ship's size value (the number of module slots).

Hangars are capable of sustaning a single ship per hangar at a time. If that ship is destroyed, then the hangar goes on cooldown for the amount of time indicated here. When the hangar is off of cooldown, a new ship will be generated and can launch from the hangar.
