Vegetarian rebels have developed a sick taste for the leaves of their own people. They have been rumored to sometimes even eat themselves.
Champions of the Freed Owlwok rebellion, these courageous troops fight to free their enslaved brothers and sisters.
Espousing a radically xenophobic agenda, these troops fight to overthrow a government they feel is too xeno-friendly.
Espousing a radically xenophobic agenda, these troops fight to overthrow a government they feel is too xeno-friendly.
These noble troops fight to tear down the ruling council and to replace it with a fairly elected democratic parliment.
These Kulrathi have lost themselves to bloodlust, living only for battle, glory, and honor.
Cybernetic drones that have evolved a sense of independence, they fight only to retain their unique consciousness seperate from the hive mind.
Heretical Ralyeh priests who question the emperor's spiritual connection with The Elder God.
The intellectual class has risen up and fights to promote education and individual rights.

Indicates the amount of EMP damage inflicted per shot. All ships have a natural EMP resistance equal to their size. When EMP damage exceeds a ship's EMP resistance, then the ship will temporarily be disabled. Ships shed EMP damage naturally at a fixed rate regardless of size.

This module launches repair drones equipped with nano-repair modules. These drones will automatically target and heal nearby vessels. When their nanite supply is exhausted, the drones will deactivate. It is recommended to pair these modules with ordnance fabricators.

In the Ascension game mode, the goal is to be the first race to ascend to Godhood by capturing the Remnant homeworld at the center of the galaxy.

We are literally piecing together the mystery of the Remnant using the salvage we have obtained from destroyed Remnant ships. Some of this technology should be relatively simple to reverse engineer. Capturing or destroying additional Remnant ships may help us discover more about their race.
Our study of Remnant Ships has led us to believe we can build a structure that will detect incoming Remnant ships, should they every target us.
Our scientists believe that this building will allow us to detect any remnant fleet targeting a system if this building in built on any of it's planets. it will also ETA.
You currently have a peace treaty with this empire and cannot declare war until it expires

A Non-Aggression Pact is a mutual pledge to not attack one another. Entering into this pact will steadily improve your relations with the target empire. Breaking this pact will cause a serious negative impact on your relationship with every other empire.

An open borders treaty will allow you to move freely within the other empire's space. Note that this is not necessarily a reciprocal treaty. If you offer open borders then the target empire will be able to move within your space as if it were there own. However, you will need the target empire to offer you open borders as well if you wish to move freely within their space. The target empire will not become angry with you for having ships in their space if they have opened their borders to you.
Peace treaties last for 100 turns. During this time, neither empire may declare war on the other empire. Existing grievances between the two empires will slowly abate.

Trade treaties create wealth for both empires depending on how long the treaty has been in effect. At the beginning of a trade treaty, both empires will lose income while the trade routes are established. After a period of time, the trade treaties will eventually break even and then begin to produce profits.

Alliances are serious commitments between two or more empires. Alliance members will expect you to war upon their enemies and will become angry if you refuse. Alliances carry all of the benefits of open borders treaties and non-aggression pacts as well. Finally, Alliances increase the maximum trust possible between two empires, meaning that large trade deals can occur more frequently.
This mysterious building appears to be the origin of the Remnant Control signal. We need to get a team on the ground to investigate it, but it is heavily defended.
An ancient portal of some kind

We believe that we can engineer an antidote to the Cordrazine control serum used to enslave the Owlwoks. Ideally we could spread this antidote via a bomb dropped into the atmosphere of a Cordrazine world, freeing the Owlwoks from their slavery.
This device will spread a fast-acting antidote to the mind control serum used by the Cordrazine to enslave the Owlwoks.

This large metal bulkhead provides moderate protection for your internal systems at a low cost. This module is not suitable for use in external slots because the metal is not treated for protection against the rigors of space travel.

This small metal bulkhead provides protection for your internal systems at a low cost. This module is not suitable for use in external slots because the metal is not treated for protection against the rigors of space travel.

Recruit a new Agent to engage in Espionage activities
Select another Empire if you wish to deploy this Agent on a mission. Otherwise, the Agent will engage in counter-espionage automatically.

Send this Agent on a mission to assassinate an enemy Agent from targeted Empire. The Agent will be on assignment for the indicated number of turns. If successful, an enemy Agent will be killed and removed from play.

Send this Agent on a mission to incite rebellion on one of target Empire's planets. The Agent will be on assignment for the indicated number of turns. If successful, hostile rebel troops will spawn on one of the enemy's planets.

Send this Agent on a mission to infiltrate an enemy colony. If successful, your agent will go Undercover to provide sensor data from that colony and you will be able to view that colony's details as if it were your own colony. Success or failure will be determined at the end of the indicated number of turns. The Agent can be reassigned to a new mission after a successful infiltration, but you will lose access to the data provided by the Agent.

Send this Agent on a mission to wreak havoc on an enemy colony. The Agent will be on assignment for the indicated number of turns. If successful, resource harvesting at the colony will be halted for a number of turns depending on your Agent's level.

Send this Agent on a mission to steal funds from targeted empire. The Agent will be on assignment for the indicated number of turns. If successful, the agent will liberate an amount of funds dependent on the Agent's level.

Send this Agent on a mission to steal an enemy technology. The Agent will be on assignment for the indicated number of turns. If successful, the Agent will steal a random enemy technology data, which would greatly help up progress in the related technology's research.

Send this Agent on a training mission. If successful, the Agent will gain one level. The Agent will be unavailable for missions for the indicated number of turns.\nTraining is not possible for Agents Level 3 or above.

Execute this mission for the indicated cost. Your chance of success (or failure) depends on the level of your agent and the difficulty of the task being undertaken. Defending Agents will also have a chance to foil your mission.\nTraining is not possible for Agents Level 3 or above/

You can increase or decrease the game speed with the +/- keys. The maximum game speed is normally capped at 4x speed. You may disable that cap with this option. Note that higher game speeds may result in low frame rates.
Other races may seek to build bigger ships; we seek to build better ships. With this technology our ships will be the mightiest in the galaxy!

This laser employs a clever two-way magnetic field to direct energy into an asteroid where it breaks up the ores inside; the ores are then propeled by energy of the laser blast back towards the mining ship, using a second magnetic field to contain and funnel the ores to the proper cargo recepticle.

The Ship does not have a Command Module or all your Command Modules are not getting power.
Add a Command Module to your ship (Cockpit, Bridge, etc.) and make sure it is getting power.

The ship currently has only a single Command Module, which is a problem for a ship of this size. When all Command Modules of a ship are destroyed, it cannot identify targets and will usually retreat for repairs.
Add a backup Command Module to the ship (it can be a small one), preferably far from your main Command Module in order to maintain combat effectiveness of the ship.

You can add a Reactor near the unpowered modules, or increase the power radius of current Reactors by placing a Power Conduit next to them.

You must add Ordnance stores or Ordnance Fabricators to your ship. The more Ordnance your ship has on board, the longer it can sustain itself in the battlefield before needing resupply.
The ship has low effective fighting time (for it's size) on the battlefield, due to the presence of Ordnance consuming weapons, coupled with low Ordnance stores.
Add Ordnance stores or Ordnance Fabricators to your ship. The more Ordnance your ship has on board, the longer it can sustain itself in the battlefield before needing resupply.
The ship's ability to sustain Warp Speed is limited

The ship does not have enough Reactors to properly recharge itself. It will have reduced or no effectiveness in the battlefield.

The ship is not Warp capable or it's warp engines are unpowered. This might be ok for small craft like Fighters or even Corvettes dedicated for Carrier or Colony Defense.

Add weapon systems which can target Fighters.
No weapon on board the ship can target Corvettes. This will probably cripple the ship's ability to deal with Corvettes, especially for small craft as Fighters or Corvettes.
Add weapon systems which can target Corvettes.
No weapon on board the ship can target larger ships as Frigates and above. This will probably cripple the ship's ability to deal with Capitals, especially for Capital ships.
Add weapon systems which can target Capitals.
The ship does not have enough Point Defense weapons on board for it's size. This might make it vulnerable to Missile barrages.
Add point Defense capable weapons. Note that dedicated Point Defense is generally better than dual purpose systems, as they are not distracted by other targets.
The ship can fire all of it's Energy weapons for a limited time. This issue's severity is a function of the time the ship can fire. Very low Energy weapon time may cripple the ship.

Add Energy storage to increase Energy weapon times. It is not mandatory for weapon time to be infinite, as oftentimes the ship does not fire all of it's weapons, especially if it has multiple weapon arcs

States any design issues the current ship has. It is displayed after you completed 75% of the design. The color of the issue indicates it's severity (Green for Informative up to Red for Critical). Click on the text to view them.
The ship cannot sustain all of its beam weapons firing at once. It's energy reserves are too low.
Add Reactors or Energy storage to increase burst Energy power times.
Due to high ratio of Energy to Ordnance requiring weapons, the ship will not go to resupply if it's ammo reserves are low during combat.
Generally, the ship will stay in combat with slightly reduced combat effectiveness, but it will be able to fight. It is up to you if you want to reduce the number of Energy weapons.
This ship has a blend of Kinetics and Energy weapons (Point Defense is not counted). When you directly order it to attack a target, it will not go to resupply if it's ordnance reserves are low.
The ship might have reduced effectiveness when fighting with only energy weapons under your direct order. It will, however, go to resupply when the designated target is destroyed.
The current number of Troops the ship has on board is lower than the number of Assault Bays installed. Not all Assault Shuttles will be able to launch when needed.
Add more Barracks modules to the ship.
The ship has less than expected numbers of Troops on board for it's size. Troops garrisoned on board a ship help defend enemy boarding attempts.
Add more Barracks modules to the ship.
Combat efficiency after power reserves are exhausted would be
The ship consumes more energy than it's Reactors can output. This means the ship combat efficiency will be reduced after it's Power Reserves are exhausted.
Add Reactors to offset the excess power consumption, or Energy Storage to increase Powered Weapon time.
The ship consumes more ordnance in a single bust of all it's weapons than it has stores for. The ship will operate at lower efficiency.
Add ordnance storage to support burst Ordnance usage. Current Ordnance Weapon Efficiency is
Low Weapon Accuracy can make smaller targets hard to hit such as fighters, corvettes, frigates, and critical ship systems.
Improve Accuracy with higher FCS control systems or more accurate weapons. Check the module information for individual weapon accuracy or zoom out to see targeting display.
We feel that the time for hostilities is at an end, and request a peace treaty.

We will open our borders to you and allow you to use our subspace pathways.
Additionally, we are willing to make a mutual pledge of Non - Aggression.
You must open your borders to our ships.
So long as you comply with this request, we will agree to a pact of Non - Aggression.
We are willing to make a mutual pledge of Non - Aggression.
Furthermore, we request a treaty allowing the private citizens of our empires the freedom to trade with one another.
We propose a treaty allowing the private citizens of our empires the freedom to trade with one another.

We require that you take control of the following colonies:

Click to rush production from this colony's storage.
 
A single click will apply 10 production from storage to current production.
 
CTRL-Click to add as much production currently available.
 
Shift-Click will try to rush this item until completed while draining your Treasury.
The amount of production rushed will be also deducted from your Empire's Treasury.
 
Construction cannot be rushed if there are ground invaders on your colony.
Manual Trade: Orders this freighter to transport food. This ship will transport food from exporting planets to importing plants. Right click to turn this off.

Manual Trade: Orders this freighter to transport production. This ship will transport production from exporting planets to importing plants If this is a group of freighters. Right click to turn this off.
production per turn per assigned colonist
research per turn per assigned colonist

Randomly places an Agent on an enemy colony, providing several key benefits. 
 
 Most importantly, the Agent gives you an additional 10% to effectiveness of your espionage investments. The more Agents you have, the faster you will be able to gain intelligence penetration. 
 
 Second, Agents give you the ability to inspect the colony where they are placed as if the colony were your own.

A space port connects to the orbital star base above and allows for the construction of ships here using materials produced on the planet. Provides a 50% bonus to all monetary incomes earned on this planet.

Imperial Offices allow for the direct taxation of the citizenry, granting incomes at a rate of .25 credits per colonist per turn. This base income is not modified by tax rates or buildings that modify tax incomes.
This shield provides 10,000 hp worth of protection in a 120 meter radius. It has a high power cost.
This particular shield model provides 2000 hp worth of defense within a 75 meter protective radius.
This small shield is capable of absorbing up to 500 damage in a radius of 50. Its quick recharge rate makes it ideal for small fighter craft.

Terraforming planets is a slow process but it can produce excellent results. Any planet with a fertility score lower than 1.0 can benefit from the effects of a terraformer. Terraforming will never increase a planet's fertility beyond 1.0.
Cloning Centers increase the population growth of a planet at a fixed rate of .02 per turn.

Xeno Farms are large complexes dedicated to the successful integration of our farming and husbandry techniques with alien soils and nutrients. The production of this building scales with the number of farmers assigned on this planet. Provides +1 food per turn per assigned colonist.
This is a monstrous shield with the a high resistance and a massive protection radius, making it ideal for capital ships or specialized shield ships. The power costs are enormous.
This shield provides 25,000 hp of protection in a radius of 400. It has extreme power costs.

Deep Core Mines are extremely effective at rapidly extracting minerals from deep within a planet's core, but are environmentally disastrous. Adds flat rate production equal to four times a planet's mineral richness but permanently decreases a planet's fertility by 2.
-2 fertility on build, +4x production richness bonus

This module contains all of the equipment, food, and colonists necessary to start a new colony on a distant world, including a small number of colonists as well as 2 food and 2 production to jump start their efforts. Colonizing a planet will consume the ship used to colonize, but if it carries troops, they will land on the planet. Cargo modules will add to the number of colonists the colony ship can load.

If the bridge is the brain of a starship then Main Engineering is its beating heart. This module generates a large subspace field capable of allowing capital ships to reach Warp Speeds. It also generates a substantial amount of power. However, if the main reactor is destroyed then a massive explosion will claim all but the hardiest of ships.
Harnesses a matter/anti-matter reaction to create large amounts of power. Explodes when destroyed.
Ship will avoid engaging in combat. Good for scouts or non-combat ships
Gain an empire-wide 50% bonus to the amount of power that is stored in fuel cells
This heavy laser beam has pinpoint accuracy over large distances although its power to damage ratio is somewhat inefficient.
Ships equipped with a subspace scanning module have a substantially increased sensor range. Only a ship's best sensor bonus will apply.
The DialCorp Inhibitor 2.0 prevents enemy ships from engaging their FTL drives in a moderate radius. It requires incredible amounts of power to operate. Multiple inhibitors do not stack.
This small ordnance pod for equipping fighters and other small craft with the ordnance needed to engage in a sustained battle

Although useless against shielded targets, this weapon will strip a starship's boarding defenses by killing troops and crew. The effectiveness of the blaster is somewhat random, having an approximately 50% chance to strip 1 point of defense per second.

A bomb bay specially equipped to deliver prion-based death spore ordnance to planetary surfaces. This weapon is ineffective against hard targets but very effective against ground troops and planetary population. The Target planet will suffer temporary reduction to its Fertility level. Constant bombing might permanently reduce fertility and even change the plant climate forever.
A basic cargo hold with rudimentary life support capabilities. This particular hold can store 1 unit of either food or production, or a small number of colonists.

Flak Turrets are mounted on swivel platforms for a 90 degree field of fire. They fire explosive shells with a moderate damaging radius, but the projectiles are somewhat slow and ill-suited for tracking swift targets. Furthermore, this weapon requires ordnance to fire.
Scatter flak turrets fire standard flak munitions in a 3-round spread. The salvo is more effective against swift targets and also provides greater potential damage per salvo on larger ships.
This mysterious crystalline shard emits an enigmatic radiation that induces good health and long life. \n\n+50% population growth

This is an extremely advanced quantum targeting computer that specifically is tuned to analyze and bypass shifting energy shield frequencies. \n\nProvides a 10% chance that your weapons (all types!) will penetrate enemy shields

This is a collection of seeds that have clearly undergone extensive and advanced genetic manipulation. In fact, these seeds don't even seem to be programmed with DNA at all, but instead with some sort of alternative gene sequencing that is beyond anything we have ever seen. \n\nProvides a +0.1 Fertility bonus to any planet that you own or colonize
This is control device linked to a semi-sentient swarm of subspace-dwelling nanocreatures. Whoever possesses the control device controls the swarm. \n\nProvides a +10% empire-wide production bonus
This shard of crystal emits a form of radiation that causes incredible muscular growth. Any ground troops exposed to it become stronger. \n\nProvides +10% Combat Strength to all of your ground troops

This particular shard of crystal entrances all who gaze upon it with a flood of pure, true knowledge. The experience is so intense, however, that our mortal minds can only understand a tiny fraction of what is shown to us. \n\nProvides a +10% empire-wide research bonus

This shard of crystal induces in its viewer an intense feeling of emotional and physical joy. The profits that could be made off of controlling access to this crystal are enourmous. \n\nProvides +10 credits per turn to its controller
This scepter is crowned with a brilliant crystal that induces a feeling of trust and well-being in all who view it. \n\nProvides a +10% bonus to your diplomatic efforts

This crystal appears perfectly spherical upon first glance. However, upon closer inspection it is revealed to be infinitely-faceted at all levels of magnification. But even more astonishing is that these facets reflect images of distant places -- possibly of all places everywhere. We can only begin to utilize this device for practical purposes. \n\nProvides a +25% bonus to the sensor range of its possessor

This incredible machine is clearly meant to process sheets of armor by manipulating it on some quantum scale. While the technology of this machine is far beyond our understanding, we are able to use it to strengthen our own armor. \n\nProvides a +10% bonus to the hitpoints of its possessor's ships

Just a taste of this very valuable spice will awaken the sleeping mind. The effect, however, is short-lived. \n\nProvides a +10% bonus to empire-wide research and a +10% bonus to the combat strength of ground troops

This is a point defense laser cannon with a swivel mount, making it ideal for fighter-class vessels or for capital ship defense. Point Defense weapons automatically engage incoming missiles and have bonus damage versus missile weapons.

A planet's Mineral Richness directly affects the speed at which a colony creates Production. Mineral Richness slowly decays. The decay rate is affected by production rate and planet's size (larger planets will decay slower than smaller ones. A planet cannot decay below 0.1 Richness.
Launches corvette class vessels as well as frigates sized 60 or less
Quantanium Armor plating has a density 10 times that of steel, making it incredibly strong but also incredibly massive. It is expensive to produce.
Change audio, video, and gameplay settings. Changes do not require restart.
The Hyperspace Flux has abated \nShips may once again warp freely
A massive hyperspace flux is inhibiting warp travel throughout the galaxy
has suddenly shifted in its orbit, resulting in an improved climate
has experienced a massive volcanic eruption \nThe environment has been severely damaged

Add ship designs to this fleet from the panel on the right. Use 'Shift' key to place multiple ships of the same type. When you are done, you can press the 'Requisition' button, which will search your empire for ships that can fill your fleet. If you do not have the ships, it will order that they are built at a suitable planet.\n\nReturn here at any time to requisition replacements for any ships that are lost in combat.

You are not currently editing a fleet. Click a hotkey on the left side of the screen to begin creating or editing the corresponding fleet.\n\nWhen you are finished editing, you can save your fleet design to disk for quick access in the future.

Add ship designs to this fleet from the panel on the right. Use shift key to place multiple ships of the same type. When you are done, you can press the 'Requisition' button, which will search your empire for ships that can fill your fleet. If you do not have the ships, it will order that they are built at a suitable planet.\n\nReturn here at any time to requisition replacements for any ships that are lost in combat.
You may scrap this building by right clicking on it

This crystalline structure syncs with and amplifies the brain waves of biological organisms. Simply put, everything that gets near to it becomes smarter. +1 research per turn to the owner of this planet

Commodities are special resources that are limited in number and provide unique bonuses to colonies that possess them. Commodities are harvested automatically at colonies where they occur naturally. They can then be moved throughout your empire using freighters. You may specify whether you wish to import or export any commodities you have access to in this panel.

This broadside-mounted cannon is capable of delivering a higher-powered kinetic blast than its turret-mounted cousins. Weapon mobility and target tracking are traded for the opportunity to unleash hellish volleys of unaimed fire.

The delay between auto saves. This is measured in unpaused, game relative seconds.
--Common Durations--
60 = 1 Minute
300 = 5 Minutes (Default)
600 = 10 Minutes

Corners is a 4 race match similar to a sandbox game, except the map is divided into quarters, with 1 faction in each quarter, offering clear boundaries between regions of space. Defend your territory at all costs!
The total number of module slots available on the selected ship.
has been struck by a meteor! \nThe environment was adversely affected and many people died,\nThe meteor was comprised mostly of useful minerals.
has transformed to a Habitable planet!\n We might want to colonize it.
has been struck by a meteor! \nThe environment was adversely affected, but the\n meteor was comprised mostly of useful minerals.

Weapon target error radius measured in ship slots. An accuracy of -6 means the weapon will hit within a 6 slot radius of the target point. above or below range 2300 The error will gradually increase or decrease. Fire Control Systems, turreted weapons, traits, and crew level can modify this
Higher Mineral Decay increases the loss chance of planet mineral Richness when it outputs high production. Note that this is also affected by game difficulty.
Add extra planets to each system, avoiding lone stars as well.
This will slightly increase research cost per technology.
Add to all Starting Empire Planets this Value.
Minimum warp range a ship must have before it needs to recharge for the AI to build it.
Time in seconds per turn. Production, Food, Research and Treasury calculations are performed per turn.
Multiply Global Maintenance cost by the value specified. Subspace Projectors are not affected.
Send automatic error reports to Blackbox developers.
This will prevent asteroids from being generated in new games, offering performance improvements in mid to late game. This will not affect current games or existing saves.
Add Notifications regarding enemies in your systems after you load a game, to remind you which systems are under attack.
This will let you easily export specific save to help the developers investigate issues. You will see the export button in the save/load screen.
Changes the simulation frequency. Lower values are faster, but inaccurate. Higher values are accurate, but slower. If your game is lagging due to high number of ships, try lowering this to 30 or 20.
Disabling bloom effect will increase performance on low-end devices
We returned the ship which was raided by rival pirates\ndue to your protection contract with us, you're welcome.
Our Scientists report that they observed increased\nradiation signatures in the galaxy and it is possible\nthat the Remnants are getting stronger.

Our Scientists report that they observed increased
radiation signatures in the galaxy. They believe
a new, powerful object has manifested somewhere
and it is related to the Remnants.
Your Scientists report massive radiation increase\nin the galaxy. They suspect another Remnant portal\nwas created in the galaxy!
number of bases was reduced\nto around
have a flagship\nlurking somewhere in the galaxy.

When Toggled (Red), any module you mark as obsolete will not be shown in the module lists. When not toggled, obsolete modules names would be shown, but would be painted red. You can mark a module as obsolete in the Active Module tab.
Indicates that this module can be rotated using the arrow keys
This module was marked as obsolete. You can reinstate it in the Active Module tab.

Mark this module as obsolete. You will not see it next time you browse the module categories. Selecting an obsolete module on existing design is possible. Clicking this button again will remove the obsolete mark from this module.
Show only ships which are assigned to Fleets
Show only ships which are not assigned to Fleets

Indicates this module has a Turreted weapon installed and it's fire arc can be rotated. Click and hold this module while installed on the ship and move the mouse to rotate the arc by 15 degrees intervals. You can also hold Shift to rotate in 1 degree intervals.
This module can be rotated and it's weapon fire arc can be changed as a turret.

For a ship to be warp capable, it must have a Warp Core installed. Warp Cores provide a Warpable Mass Capacity. If a ship's mass is less than or equal to a ship's Warpable Mass, then it can achieve faster than light travel.
This warp core is small and inefficient but is capable of driving a ship farther and faster than any conventional propulsion system
This fighter-bomber weapon has a relatively huge impact for its size. It has a small guidance package but relies on the momentum of its mothership for its speed.
An energy-based Space Bomb that is twice as effective versus shields
With the proper equipment, swarms of small vessels can be a danger to even the largest ships

Making an object with mass travel faster than the speed of light is not possible in real space. A warp drive achieves FTL travel by encasing a ship's mass in a subspace bubble, effectively removing it from real space while the drive is engaged.
Subspace Tunneling is the science of identifying the most efficient route between two real space points in the decidedly more complicated web of subspace
By integrating new advances in the fields of cooling and power transfer, we are able to build a larger and more efficient warp core suited for use in capital ships
A balanced engine that provides decent thrusting and maneuvering capabilities as well as an afterburner for inter-system travel
This engine has only two states: off or full burn. It is not suitable as a maneuvering engine but is the most efficient engine for sublight inter-system travel
This engine provides excellent combat maneuvering and thrusting but has no afterburner capabilities. It is less efficient than other engines
Advances in cooling and propellant delivery mechanisms are allowing us to reach farther and farther into the stars.
While it may not seem entirely safe to do so, we have discovered that we can create small nuclear explosions behind our ships and capture this energy to reach interstellar targets

The theory for the Impulse Drive is similar to the Nuclear Drive. The real advancement is in our ability to control the strength of the explosions, allowing a more general application of the technology
This newest generation of engines provides larger, more powerful, and more efficient sublight thrusters
A combat thruster featuring an improved thrust to power ratio
A more powerful and efficient frigate-sized afterburner meant for long-range burns
A balanced and efficient frigate engine
Bigger, better, and more efficient than earlier designs, these engines are suitable for usage on cruiser class vessels
A large and efficient cruiser-class afterburner engine for making long range sub-light burns
A balanced cruiser engine with good combat and afterburner performance
A high-powered engine designed to provide combat maneuverability to cruiser-class vessels
The pinnacle of sub-light engine technology, these engines are meant for the largest of ships
A monstrous and powerful engine for sub-light combat maneuvers
A titanic afterburner for sub-light acceleration
A massive and balanced engine for use on the largest ships
When our scientists thought about how to make Space Bombs more effective, the best they could come up with was to make a bigger bomb
This weapon is affectionately called the Mother of All Space Bombs due to its huge blast effect
The number of explosive threats in the galaxy mandates further investment in point defense weaponry
All point defense weapons receive a 25% bonus to their rate of fire
All point defense weapons receive a 25% bonus to the speed of their projectiles
All point defense weapons receive a 25% bonus to their range
The beating heart of a capital ship, this warp core is massive, powerful, and efficient
Building large reactors that are fit for space travel is really a matter of containing the radioactive and thermal output of the reactor to protect ship crew and systems
This cell stores reactor fuel suitable for use in Warp Reactor and afterburner engines
This device stores power, which is required for the operation of many ship systems including shields, weapons, and certain types of engines
These rare metals are raw materials suitable for refinement into usable reactor fuel. A fuel refinery is required to process these materials.
This building converts raw Fissionable Materials into usable Reactor Fuel, creating 100 reactor fuel per 1 Fissionable Material available each turn
A mine that extracts raw Fissionable Materials from a planet with the Fissionable Materials Resource. The more Fissionable Materials resources a planet has, the faster the extraction
Trees? Who needs trees. What your people needed was room for more factories. +1 homeworld richness, -1 homeworld fertility
The data-stream from the Remnant Mothership holds the key to the Mystery of the Remnant. We need to study it immediately, before we're all destroyed!

As the Remnant Exterminators sweep across the galaxy, burning and killing all that they find, you step inside the completed Ascension Array. In one glorious moment you are given True Knowledge. You are all things that have ever lived. You know all the joys and sorrows of your people and every people to ever populate the galaxy. You experience lives beyond counting. You are Father and Son reunited, friend and foe, predator and prey. You are the light at the end of the tunnel. \n \n And you are not alone.

WARNING: CPU INTENSE! This option will force a full combat simulation for 100% accuracy even when battles are occurring out of sight and between non-player factions, including detailed module targeting. If this option is unchecked, approximations will be used to speed up the game when occurring well outside the players view, and for some aspects of combat between AI factions.

Fire Control Systems or FCS. This indicates how powerful weapon fire control is on the ship. Higher FCS increases weapon accuracy and target tracking. Weapon accuracy is the highest FCS of any module except where noted. Tacking systems is accumulated FCS.
Defines the radius of planetary gravity wells. Larger values means ships need to be further away from a planetary body to engage FTL, et vice versa.

FTL Overlay: visualizes subspace projection and FTL inhibiting gravity wells and fields.

Weapons Range Overlay: visualizes ships' maximum weapon range. When a ship is selected, you will see green circles with Yellow, Orange and Red borders (shortest, average and maximum weapon range, correspondingly). The blue circle is the Sensor Range of the ship. Enemy Circles will be Red.

Indicates the % chance of ECM disruption against incoming guided weapons, before the weapon's ECM resistance is deducted. Successful ECM disruption jams targeting and prevents the munition from hitting.
Indicates the resistance of this weapon's guidance against targets' ECM countermeasures. This is deducted from the target's ECM % when trying to maintain guidance.
Indicates the maximum duration for which this weapon may maintain its beam each time it fires.
Pauses game on notifications. Clearing notifications unpauses the game.

Scrap Ship - Order ship back to the shipyards to be scrapped. If that ship is of a foreign hull, your engineers might be able to reverse engineer the hull. If you want to Mass scrap ALL ships of this design, use the 'Ships Array' screen and order scrap with SHIFT click.
Indicates a ship's experience level. For each experience level, a ship gains a 5% bonus each to repair rate, turning speed, and weapons damage.
Ship will move within maximum weapons range and present her Port broadside to the enemy for maximum coverage
Ship will move within maximum weapons range and present her Starboard broadside to the enemy for maximum coverage
Prevents AI empires from merging into Federations at the first site of a powerful opponent. This will not prevent them from federating if they have strong, long lasting alliances.

Indicates the maximum time in seconds this ship may continuously fire all weapons before exhausting energy reserves, based on power usage of all weapons when firing. Red value indicates insufficient power to maintain fire more than 2 seconds.
Indicates the maximum time in seconds this ship may continuously fire all weapons before exhausting ordnance supplies
Indicates the amount of ordnance this ship is capable of fabricating per second
In the Capital Elimination game mode, empires are defeated when they lose their homeworld.
Indicates the maximum amount of damage repaired by beams from this system.
Indicates sensor bonus added by this module. Sensor bonuses add onto sensor range - only the highest bonus will apply.
Indicates the range of this transporter.
Indicates the power used by this when transporting.
Indicates the amount of ordnance that can be transported.
Indicates the number of troops that can be beamed down to a planet at a time.
Indicates the number of troops that this module can hold.
Indicates the amount troops are healed per second
Indicates the credits per tick this design would cost in upkeep
Indicates this ship's maximum sustained FTL jump duration outside of friendly subspace projection
Indicates the time in seconds it takes for this ship's FTL drive to charge before going to warp
The effective power drain of this module when the ship is at FTL. You will see this info only if this module has modifiers to the usual power draw at warp.
The number of troops this module can house
Indicates the total complement of troops this ship can carry
Indicates the counter-espionage strength of this empire. The strength goes up when more spies are dedicated for defense missions, but goes down when the empire expands.
Random chance this weapon will fire through enemy shields. Golden color means that this value is modified from the original number.
This weapons fire a salvo of projectiles
Indicates the amount of shields that are drain from the target and is added to this ships power store.
Indicates the amount of drag added to target ship to slow it down.
Indicates the amount of power that a target ship loses.
Indicates the number of troops that can be transported onto enemy ships with shields down.
Your Empire will automatically select technologies to research.
Your Empire will automatically manage taxes and treasury.

Using this slider, you can lower the FTL speeds of enemy ships that are within the gravity wells of Solar Systems. A value of 100% provides no penalty, whereas a value of 0% will completely inhibit warp of enemy ships in system.
The duration a beam will last from a beam type weapon.

Indicates the amount of EMP protection that this module adds to the vessel.
The total EMP protection of this design.

Weapons which do less damage than this value will simply be deflected by this Armor due to it's thickness. Beams are not affected by this due to their tunneling ability. Deflection has 10% efficiency vs. EMP Damage.
Weapons which do less damage than this value will simply be deflected by this Shield due to it's intensity. Beams are not affected by this due to their tunneling ability.
Assigns vessel to system defense duties

When active, arcs in the shipyard can only be moved by ALT-clicking them, preventing accidental rotation while providing immediate control of arcs when using ALT.\n\nWhen inactive, arcs in the shipyard can be moved by left-clicking and holding for a time delay to grab the arc.
Zoom will center on selected object.
This is a bonus to the number targets that can be tracked by this ship's fire control. As a bonus, it is cumulative and stacks on top of the command module's maximum targets.

Estimated offensive strength of the ship or module. This is based on the size of the ship and strength of defense and strength of weapons. The defensive score of the ship is not shown but it is calculated and restricted to be never more than the offensive value. Metal slugs with a few small weapons wont rate that high.

Short Range: 

Ship will rotate so that forward-firing weapons are facing its target. 
If in a fleet, it will attempt to maintain formation. If not, ship will maneuver to within minimum weapons range. 
If a carrier the ship will use the Max actual weapons range.

This value represents the complexity of this command module's fire control systems. It represents the number of targets on sensors that can be tracked and potentially engaged simultaneously. It does not stack with more command modules.

Total number of ships the scanners can track and total number incoming seeking weapons the scanners can track. Weapons can fire at any item in tracked ships or tracked seekers as is possible. Scanners attempt to track the best targets for the ship. if you plan on being surrounded this number should be high.

This is the total number of targets this ship's fire control systems can track at a time. This ship can only track a single target, so is incapable of firing at other targets, including incoming projectiles, simultaneously.
This is the total electronic countermeasure (ECM) value for this ship. It represents the baseline % chance to jam an incoming missile with no ECM resistance.

This is the maximum sensor range of this vessel: essentially how far this vessel can detect spaceborne objects. A basic local scan is available through command modules; to scan further dedicated sensor modules are required.
This is this ship's self-repair rate per tick - it can self repair this many hitpoints of a module per tick when outside of combat. Better command and engineering modules improve this.
